intro: Casearia tarapotina, commonly known as the yellow casearia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. Its fruit is a small, fleshy berry that contains several seeds. Casearia tarapotina is often found in moist, shaded areas of lowland forests.
